poem:
"Canis Machina"

Morning, light upon the porcelain news,
A story of a hound, not born but built,
Iron paws and programmed pant,
With a rifle it chants, coursing through Asian fields.
In this unplanned dance of man's conceit,
Metal muzzles paired with flesh and breath,
May we pause, just a beat,
To ponder this prelude to our own death.
